document.heading: Human Rights Genetic Information Amendment Act of 2004

history.narrative: Law 15-263, the “Human Rights Genetic Information Amendment Act of 2004”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 15-52, which was referred to the Subcommittee on Human Rights, Latino Affairs and Property. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 9, 2004, and December 7, 2004, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 3, 2005, it was assigned Act No. 15-648 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 15-263 became effective on April 5, 2005.
